page.title: 16Bagworth Churches
page.content: There are three churches in our area St.Peter's Thornton, Holy Rood Bagworth and Cross Hills Chapel in the valley between the two villages. St.Peter's Church, Thornton has approx. 50 people attending Sunday services. There are also 4 junior clubs and 2 adult groups. This is an active church, having an important role in village life. St.Peter's Church dates back to Norman times,it stands on an imposing site above the Reservoir and surrounded by towering beech trees.The spire dominates the views around Thornton and is well worth a visit. Holy Rood church in Bagworth was demolished in 1968 due to coalmining subsidence.It was re-built in a 'modern' concrete style and unfortunately only has an average congregation of 15.
